content.description: Harder start, somewhat slabby thanks to the water polished rock.
content.location: 2nd bolted route from right, left of The Company.

content.description: Very fun climb, more thin edges, fairly sustained but mostly 5.9, crux near middle.
content.location: Fifth route from right, left of Notched Arrow.

content.description: More great climbing on good edges, with some interesting variety of features.
content.location: Fourth route from the right, left of Ents Degree.

climbs.name: My Precious A2
climbs.fa: Steve Johnson, Vicki Marze, 1996, FFA: D. Merlin and J. Scott 2011

content.description: Follow the thin cracks up, move slightly leftward and haul up the bolt ladder
content.location: Left side of the rivendale wall

content.description: This route is slab that increases in difficulty steadily from the ground. It starts out at maybe 5.7 and ends up at 5.10+ near the top. The first 3/4 of the route has a lot of features, then suddenly turns into extremely thin slab for approximately the last three moves before the anchors. Don't assume you have to go straight up the bolt line for the last few moves or it may be much harder than its 10+ rating.
content.location: The 8th bolted route from the right. The 2nd to last route on the wall before the dihedral.

content.description: Very fun climb, excellent moves on great edges.
content.location: Third bolted route from right, left of Smagel.

content.description: crux between last bolt and anchor on featureless slab
content.location: furthest bolted route to the left before the dihedral, starts at the base of the elevated platform

content.description: Relatively easy 5.9, well protected crux near the middle.
content.location: First bolted climb on the right end of the wall.

content.description: Crux involves avoiding agave growing out of grungy crack.  Decent climb, probably worth doing if you've made the hike, but not the best here.
content.location: Sixth route from right, left of Return of the King.  Last climb before big crack in the wall.

content.description: Fun, straight-forward, slab route.  The first bolt is too close to the ground to be useful in a fall, and it is fairly thin to the high 2nd bolt.  Clipping the 2nd bolt may be the crux.
content.location: The 7th bolted route from the right side of the wall. Goes around a tree in a crack at the top.  You'll see the blank section at the top of "Fellowship Of The Buttonhead" next to it.

content.description: Good winter climbing area with moderate sport routes.  The hour-long hike keeps out the crowds, but it is well worth the approach.  The climbs are fun and the area is very pretty, right along the streambed.  No road noise here.  The wall faces west/southwest and gets winter sun by noon.  Most of the climbs start on slightly water-polished stone then work up to very nice edges.  The wall is mostly vertical, but some climbs are fairly sporty and have fun moves.
